data.title: Dedicated to providing a quality experience
data.text:
My son and I came to brunch at The Greenhouse with a friend. She had the tomato soup and grilled cheese (excellent) and I had the burger served with avocado. Absolutely fantastic!

My son ordered a mango smoothie, my friend had the mango juice. She raved about the juice, but my son said the smoothie (which looked great) tasted like water. My friend tried it and, sure enough, it was incredibly bland. We send it back and asked for juice instead. 

The server brought us a second try at the mango smoothie, but it was still bland (as my friend confirmed after my son tried it). They then brought mango juice, which my son really enjoyed. Just as we were preparing to leave, the server brought out a third mango smoothie for my son to try, and this time it was a hit! Turns out more yogurt and honey did the trick.

I am very impressed with the server's dedication to providing a quality experience. Most would have just brought us the juice and not pursued the smoothie issue any further. We left with an excellent smoothie in hand (no charge). This is our third or fourth time at the Jefferson and they never disappoint! We'll definitely be back.

data.title: Amazing Breakfast with Old World Charm
data.text: If Lobster and Eggs is up your alley, this is a must do.  From their amazing cappuccino to their elegant display, you'll be overwhelmed at every turn.  (Their jams and breads are absolutely addictive.)

owner_response.author: JeffersonDC, Manager at The Greenhouse at The Jefferson Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear M H,

Thank you for taking the time to post about your recent dining experience at The Greenhouse. I was pleased to read that you enjoyed your meal and I hope we can welcome you back again soon!

Sincerely,
David Bueno
Hotel Manager
dbueno@jeffersondc.com
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wonderful Breakfast Atmosphere
data.text: The Greenhouse is a wonderful breakfast restaurant.  The staff is very attentive and the food is excellent.

data.title: Lovely dining room
data.text: The Greenhouse at The Jefferson Hotel is a gorgeous restaurant.  We had breakfast there which was excellent with a nice variety of items on the menu.  I especially recommend the lemon ricotta pancakes.  The wait staff is efficient and helpful.  It is a great way to start your day.  I only wish we had had more time to enjoy additional meals there.

data.title: Best Place to Brunch Morning of Wedding
data.text: On the day of my wedding, I was joined by a few close family members for a perfect brunch.  The setting is beautiful and bright, flowers were so lovely, the entire building was a wonderful place to visit and dine.  Perfect backdrop for photos as well.  I ordered the Croque Monsieur and split that and Waffles (so I could taste both).  Highly recommend either!  Definitely large portions, but elegant and not at all stuffy.  I liked the coffee and the fruit and muffins had by some others in my party also received high marks.  The staff was exceptionally friendly and the service top notch. I have long heard about The Jefferson as a really special place and I recommend you try it.  While having historic beauty, it is also welcoming, friendly, updated and varied in its decor and style.  I will definitely return.  The valet parking made getting it there easy for people from all areas.

data.title: Elegant, but overpriced
data.text:
I don't typically travel like this. I definitely don't pay this much for a breakfast. But, I was traveling with my CEO for work, and she wanted me to "get a feel" of the Jefferson's breakfast, which she always raves about.

So it was that I found myself sitting at a tiny table with my CEO and one of our consultants, sipping out of a $6 cup of coffee, buttering a $4 English muffin and picking through my $8 bowl of "fresh fruit". (I put that in quotes because there were quite a few bruised and old pieces of fruit in that bowl.)

I know I'm making light of this, but those who know my travel habits know that I'm not about to spend this much on a meal - especially breakfast - without good reason. 

Yes, the service was spectacular. They were always there, providing for every little whim my dining companions had. They were gracious and welcoming, and remembered my CEO's preferences from her many trips there prior. I appreciate that (it's nice to see others taking care of the woman I spend so much of my own time taking care of, you know?)

My meal was really very basic, so I don't feel right commenting on that (other than the old berries that were at the bottom of my bowl). You can't really mess up a toasted muffin and coffee (the coffee was pretty good, I will say). 

The ambiance of the restaurant is really nice - it's kind of elegant without being too pompous about it. 

Unfortunately, there are no pictures of my meal, as I didn't want to go into full-on paparazzi mode with my CEO there, and I felt like the servers would've frowned on my camera phone clicking away.

data.title: Outstanding breakfast
data.text:
We visited The Greenhouse at the Jefferson for breakfast while in DC for a week.  (Unfortunately we had not discovered the Jefferson to stay there...)
Breakfast here is a real treat, whether you are a resident or not.  Service is beyond excellent - nothing is too much effort, and the waiters pick up on the smallest details.  The dining room is gorgeous: elegant and sophisticated.
Breakfast choices include the standard fare, but beautifully presented.  Afterwards, we retired to the library with coffee to just soak in the surroundings.  It was lovely.  Highly recommended.

data.title: Lovely Brunch
data.text: The homemade muffins are a must try- we had one of each flavor : Blueberry, Cranberry/orange and Cappuccino. Not too large and warm & fresh from the over, melted in your mouth - no too heavy at all. The bloody mary was good and spicy and service was good but not overly doting. The Salmon tartar was delicious as was the Croque Madame and the benedicts (traditional and lobster). Only the minestrone left us short. Atmosphere was lovely and the quiet tone was perfect for an intimate brunch.

data.title: FOOD & SERVICE 5 STAR
data.text:
You can't beat the service and the food is wonderful.
Atmosphere is delightful. You feel like you are eating in a garden.

data.title: Great breakfast and lunch
data.text: Not inexpensive, but very well done - good food and excellent service.  I just wish the Quill served breakfast until at least noon  - no one can be perfect.

data.title: Fantastic Brunch
data.text: The saturday brunch at the Greehouse was exactly what we expected.  The atmosphere was fantastic. The Jefferson is a beautiful boutique hotel and the restaurant reflected it.  Love the touch of bringing a stool for my wife' bag, so that it doesn't sit on the floor was quite fascinating.  The food was fanstasic. Salmon tartare was the best we've ever had. And the coffee... after all the Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts coffee, it was an experience to have such a finely roasted smooth coffee.  The Eggs benedict was perfect for my wife and my steak and eggs was pretty good. I wouldn't give my entree a 5 star but about 3.5.  The brunch isn't cheap by any means, but for a special occasion, it was perfect for our special visit.

owner_response.author: JeffersonDC, Manager at The Greenhouse at The Jefferson Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear dagatorman,

Thank you for taking the time to post about your recent dining experience in Greenhouse. I’m pleased to read that you enjoyed your meal and found the atmosphere to be to your liking.

I do hope we have the opportunity to welcome you and your wife back in the future!

Sincerely,

Anne-Sophie Litzler
Director Food & Beverage
alitzler@jeffersondc.com
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Perfect for Breakfast
data.text: Breakfast menu was very good.  None of that buffet stuff that you often fins in hotel restaurants; all prepared just for us.  We will go back the next time we stay at the Jefferson.

data.title: Perfect for both business and pleasure
data.text:
On arrival we were met by the super Betsy who managed our various requests with great charm. The service throughout the meal was excellent. Attentive and professional without being overly intrusive.  The food was delicious. I had the lobster eggs Benedict and they are highly recommended.  

This was a working breakfast. However, I will soon be back for another visit, this time for pleasure.

data.title: The Best Brunch
data.text: My title for this review is an accurate description of this establishment.  The décor is classic and bright which make for a pleasant experience.  Every employee was meticulous in their appearance and manner in which they conduct themselves.  The menu is well versed providing options to fit any pallet.  I started with the tuna tartar, avocado, and cream cheese, which left me speechless.  My personal silver coffee pot never fell below half-filled or cold.  We were seated in the atrium, which was lovely and private.  I look forward to returning in the near future.

data.title: Wonderful Sunday Brunch
data.text: Beautiful venue, attentive service, and excellent food all add up to a lovely dining experience.  Highly recommended!

data.title: European charm
data.text: The four of us came downtown to enjoy a fancy Saturday brunch.  We had a wonderful time with delicious food and an unrushed atmosphere.  The eggs benedict were tender and well-sauced, the cappuccino was perfect, and the service was excellent.  As an added bonus, the Christmas decorations in the lobby were worth taking some time to admire, especially the Christmas tree which was decorated with Jeffersonian items.  This is a special-occasion place for us, but one which we will long remember.

owner_response.author: JeffersonDC, Manager at The Greenhouse at The Jefferson Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Virginia S,

Thank you for taking the time to post about your recent brunch experience in Greenhouse. I was pleased to read that you found the eggs benedict and cappuccino to your liking, and that you felt the atmosphere was just right. Additionally, I’m glad that you enjoyed our holiday decorations and we look forward to welcoming you back for many special occasions to come!

Sincerely,

Anne-Sophie Litzler
Food & Beverage Director
alitzler@jeffersondc.com
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A Thanksgiving "turkey"
data.text:
We thought we had booked Thanksgiving dinner in the hotel's Plume Restaurant, instead we were seated in the lobby level Greenhouse Restaurant.  The hostess was great, very welcoming, walked us to the bar for a drink before dinner, then very cheerfully back to the restaurant when it was time to be seated.  The bartender was very friendly, too.

The 3-course holiday dinner for $102 included starter, entree, and dessert.  We started dinner with the cleverly presented beet puzzle salad, different colored beets cut into jigsaw puzzle form.  The flavor was nothing special, just nice cold pieces of beet.  All 3 of us ordered turkey and dressing.  The turkey seemed to be lightly pan-fried and was brownish, chewy and devoid of flavor.  The stuffing seemed to have been baked in a loaf and cut into round slices like english muffins or hockey pucks.  It, too, didn't have much flavor.  There was some other roundish piece of dark food on my plate which I wasn't sure was a) turkey, b) dressing or c) none of the above so I skipped it.  For dessert we each had the combo apple and pumpkin pie dish, which, was fair if nothing special.

Our server was aloof but efficient and managed to smile when it got close to tip time.

Between the bar and dinner we shared two bottles of chardonnay, at $72 a bottle one of the least expensive on the wine list.

Total cost of dinner, wine and tips for the 3 of us exceeded $600.  For this we got food we didn't particularly care for with indifferent service, and in a hotel lobby restaurant, not in the restaurant we thought we had booked. (Our mistake.)

owner_response.author: JeffersonDC, Manager at The Greenhouse at The Jefferson Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear IllinoisMike,

I was sorry to read that your Thanksgiving meal did not meet your expectations. I would enjoy the opportunity to speak with you further about your experience, and can be reached at the contact information below at your convenience. 

Sincerely, 

Sean Mulligan 
Restaurant Manager 
smulligan@jeffersondc.com
202-448-2300
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Consistently perfect
data.text: A delightful and bright way to start a day.  The menu selection accommodates any diet and desire.  The staff is attentive, precise and gracious while not interrupting - they are experts of that balance.

data.title: The french toast will change your life
data.text: Had Sunday Brunch at the Greenhouse during our stay.  Terrific experience and will definitely go back.

data.title: Special Breakfast
data.text: We dined at the Greenhouse whilst staying at the Jefferson Hotel. Like everything about the hotel it was first class. I had the Lobster Benedict which caught my attention. The breakfasts were all quite good sizes and the service was excellent. Even got a decent cup of tea. (rare in the US) Have the Lobster!
